problem: On a particular map, $3$ inches on the map equates to $10$ miles in real life. If you know that the real life distance between two buildings on the map is $53.25$ miles, what would the distance between the buildings be (in inches) on the map, expressed as a fraction?
solution: If we let the distance between the buildings on the map be $d$, then $\frac{d}{53.25} = \frac{3}{10}$. Cross-multiplying and solving for $d$, we obtain $10d = 159.75 \Rightarrow d=15.975$ inches. Expressed as a fraction, $d = 15\frac{975}{1000} = \boxed{15\frac{39}{40}},$ or $\boxed{\frac{639}{40}}$ inches.
model_solution:
Step 1: Set up the proportion of real life distance to map distance, $\frac{3\text{ inches}}{10\text{ miles}} = \frac{x\text{ inches}}{53.25\text{ miles}}$.
Step 2: Cross multiply to obtain $3(53.25) = 10x$.
Step 3: Expand and solve for x, $159.75 = 10x \Rightarrow x = \frac{159.75}{10}$.
Simplify the fraction: $x = \frac{159.75}{10} = \frac{3195}{200}$.
Simplify the fraction: 
x = 159.75/10 = 159.75/10 = 319.5/20 = 159.75/10 = 319.5/20 = 639/40
x = 639/40
x = 639/40
steps: Step 1: Set up the proportion of real life distance to map distance, $\frac{3\text{ inches}}{10\text{ miles}} = \frac{x\text{ inches}}{53.25\text{ miles}}$.
Step 3: Expand and solve for x, $159.75 = 10x \Rightarrow x = \frac{159.75}{10}$.
full_steps: Step 1: Set up the proportion of real life distance to map distance, $\frac{3\text{ inches}}{10\text{ miles}} = \frac{x\text{ inches}}{53.25\text{ miles}}$.
Step 3: Expand and solve for x, $159.75 = 10x \Rightarrow x = \frac{159.75}{10}$.
